name: Beer-Marinated Deer Jerky
author: Phillip Miller
summary: Lean deer meat marinated in beer and spices to perfection overnight, then dehydrated. The jerky takes a while to make, but it is relatively easy, and well worth the wait. My whole family loves it and I bet yours will too.
ingredients: 2 pounds lean venison, cut into thin strips
1 (12 fluid ounce) can or bottle beer (such as Budweiser®)
½ teaspoon ground black pepper, or more to taste
directions: Removing all fat and gristle from venison
Mix venison with beer, soy sauce, Worcestershire, salt, garlic, curry powder, black pepper, and ginger together in a medium stainless steel bowl
Cover and refrigerate for at least 8 hours, or overnight
Remove venison from the marinade and shake off excess
Place the meat on the racks of a dehydrator, so that there is room for the air to flow evenly over all of the pieces
Let dehydrate to desired consistency according to individual appliance instructions, 6 to 8 hours
